title: Patanisacas de bacalhau
text:
1 slice of Bacalhau
2 cloves of garlic
1 small portion of olive oil
1 small onion
3 ovos
Parsley
Beer
Flour
Salt
Pepper
oil to dip fry

title: Patanisacas de bacalhau
text:
1 slice of Bacalhau
2 cloves of garlic
1 small portion of olive oil
1 small onion
3 ovos
Parsley
Beer
Flour
Salt
Pepper
oil to dip fry

title: Patanisacas de bacalhau
text:
Preparation

shred the raw fish
Try to remove as much water as possible from the fish
Fry some garlic in olive oil and add it to the fish (olive oil included)
Mince the onion and parsley and add them to the mixture
Add som pepper
Mix to eggs and 1 yolk and Add them to the mixture
Mix some flour and the beer until having a paste that you can pick up with a spoon but still wet
Beat the remaining egg white until stiff and carefully mix it to the opther mixture
Add salt to taste
Fry one spoon of the mixture at a time

title: Carbonara
text:
100 g pasta*
80g of bacon or Guancial/Pancetta
1 large egg
15g pecorino (or parmigiano)
salt and black pepper

* (can be gluten free pasta)

title: Carbonara
text:
100 g pasta*
80g of bacon or Guancial/Pancetta
1 large egg
15g pecorino (or parmigiano)
salt and black pepper

* (can be gluten free pasta)

title: Carbonara
text:
Preparation

Cook the pasta
While the pasta cooks, mix the yolks and cheese
On medium heat, fry the bacon unitl crispy
When cooked, mix the pasta in the frying pan with the bacon
Add a bit of the pasta water unitl it simmers
Add salt and pepper
Add the cheese and egg mixture with the heat off until it melts.
You can adjust with more water to abtain a creamy pasta

title: Pasta bolognese
text:
Tomato paste - 4 tomatoes - 1 onion - 1 garlic clove - olive oil - pinch of sugar - red wine - oregano - salt & pepper
Bolognese sauce: - 250g minced meat - red wine - 100g pasta - parmegiano - 1/2 carrot

title: Pasta bolognese
text:
Tomato paste - 4 tomatoes - 1 onion - 1 garlic clove - olive oil - pinch of sugar - red wine - oregano - salt & pepper
Bolognese sauce: - 250g minced meat - red wine - 100g pasta - parmegiano - 1/2 carrot

title: Pasta bolognese
text:
Preparation
Tomato paste 1. Fry minced onion and garlic in olive oil -> put half of the fried onions and garlic in a pan for the meat 2. Add tomatoes, red wine, oreganos, sugar, salt & pepper 3. Let cook until tomatoes are softened 4. Blend everything together (you may remove tomato peel before blending)
Blognese sauce 1. Add the meat and carrot to the previously added onion and garlic 2. Fry the meat until water has evaporated and all the meat has turned brown 3. Add tomato paste and red wine (half and half to cover meat) 4. Let it cook on medium heat for at least 1h until meat is soft 5. During this time cook the pasta al dente 6. Mix the pasta, meat and cheese together

title: Arroz de marisco
text:
Broth:

1 onion
2 cloves of garlic
2 leaves of laurel
70ml ollive oil
2Tsp tomato paste
250ml white wine
2Tsp of sea food soup knorr
Salt
Spicy sauce

Shrimp:

500g big shrimp

Other:

1 sea food mixture
1 crab claws and legs seperated and abdomen (without gills, eyes, mouth or carapace) cut in half
370g rice
1l water
coriander

title: Arroz de marisco
text:
Broth:

1 onion
2 cloves of garlic
2 leaves of laurel
70ml ollive oil
2Tsp tomato paste
250ml white wine
2Tsp of sea food soup knorr
Salt
Spicy sauce

Shrimp:

500g big shrimp

Other:

1 sea food mixture
1 crab claws and legs seperated and abdomen (without gills, eyes, mouth or carapace) cut in half
370g rice
1l water
coriander

title: Arroz de marisco
text:
Preparation
Make the broth in advance

Fry miced onion and garlic with the olive oil and laurel leeves
Add the sea food knorr and tomato past and mix well
Add the wite wine
Add the water
Add salt and spicy sauce to taste

Shrimp

Make a cut on the back of the shrimp

Assemble everything

Seperate the sea food mixture and add the ingredients seperatly (crab sticks aside)

small shrimp
clams
crab

Add the rice and let cook for around 10min or until the rice is cooked
Add the crab sticks
Add the shrim on top and serve with coriander on the side (some people like it others dont)

title: Chicken wings
text:
Preparation
Wings:

Cut the wings into pieces A (the oned with 2 thin bones) and pieces B (the ones with a thick bone)
For the pieces A, cut the two ends and remove the thinest bone, push the chicken into one side of the bone to create a lolipop
For the pieces B, detach the skin from the bone in the thinest side and push it like the previous piece
Let them marinage in milk
After a while, remove the chicken from the milk, add salt and pepper and dip them in flour
Fry them in your air fryer

Sauce:

Cut the pepper the red chilli and onion in cubes
Drizzle with oil and roast in the oven
mix all the ingredients
In a pan let the mixture simmer
To make it to the right texture and flavor, add olive oil, vinegar and lemon

title: Chocolate mousse
text:
(250/3)g butter
200g dark chocolate
6 Tsp sugar
6 eggs
1 tsp soluble coffee

title: Chocolate mousse
text:
(250/3)g butter
200g dark chocolate
6 Tsp sugar
6 eggs
1 tsp soluble coffee

title: Chocolate mousse
text:
Preparation

Start melting the butter and chocolate together
Seperate whites and yolks
Beat the whites until stiff and put them aside
Beat the yolks with the sugar and coffee
Make sure the chocolate and butter are melted and stired together
Add the chocolate mixture to the yolk mixture and mix
Carefully mix the stiffened egg whites
Store in the fridge

cake

title: Mandarine cake

cake

(Sirup):

salt

title: Mandarine cake
text:
Preparation

Oil a cake pan and prinkle with flour
Mix the butter and suggar until white
Add eggs and mix one by one
Add the flower and baking powder and a pinch of salt
Preheat the oven at (180°C).
Remove the juice and zest of 3 mandarines and add to the mixture
Put the mixture in the cake pan and put it in the oven for 25-30 min
During that time, bring to heat hte juice of the remaining 3 mandarines with the 100g of sugar
take the cake out of the pan and put the sirup over it

title: Pastel de nata
text:
210ml milk
1 puff pastry (rectangular is better)
4 yolks
125g sugar
25g flour (rice or corn flour)
60ml water
lemon peel

title: Pastel de nata
text:

1 puff pastry (rectangular is better)
4 yolks
125g sugar
25g flour (rice or corn flour)
60ml water
lemon peel

title: Pastel de nata
text:
Preparation

roll pastry and cut sections of 2cm
put butter on the molds and spread pastry
in a pot heat 125ml milk and lemon peel
In another reciepient mix flour and the 85ml of milk
When the milk starts to boil remove from the heat, rwmove the lemon peel and mix the two mixtures together
Boil the water and sugar for 5 min or until it starts to be “sticky” like it’s becoming caramel
Mix both mixtures and let them cool down
Once colder, mix the yolks one at the time (so they don’t cook)
Put the cream in the pastry bowls and oven for 15min at 240 degrees C

title: Arroz Doce
text:
Ingredients (9 servings)
Vanilla Extract: .5 tsp Rice risoto/4milk rice: 125g sugar: 220g egg yolks:3 lemon peels: 2 cinamon sticks: 1 butter: 25g water: 0.25l milk: .5 cup milk: 850ml salt cinamon powder


Instructions

Numa panela, leve ao lume a água e o arroz. Tempere com um pouco de sal e deixe cozer até a água secar.
Depois da água evaporar, junte a manteiga, as cascas de limão, os paus de canela e o leite. Mexa e deixe cozer durante 30 minutos. Mexa de vez em quando para não agarrar no fundo. Passado os 30 minutos acrescente o açúcar.
Dissolva as gemas com a chávena de leite. Enquanto mexe, junte as gemas ao arroz e quando começar a borbulhar apague o lume.
Depois de servido em taças, leve o arroz doce ao frigorifico. Depois de frio, polvilhe com canela e está pronto a servir.

title: Raspberry Licor
text:
250g raspberries
250ml Cachaça
250g sugar
250ml water

title: Raspberry Licor
text:
250g raspberries
250ml Cachaça
250g sugar
250ml water

title: Raspberry Licor
text:
Preparation

Wash the raspberies
Mix the raspberries and cachaça and let macerate for at least 30 days, while mixing on average once a day
Remove the raspberries and save as much liquid as possible
Mix the sugar and water in a pan in high heat
When it starts to simmer, lower the temperature and let it thicken for around 15min
When thickened (but is not caramel) take it out of the heat and let it cool until ~40 degrees C

If to hot it will evaporate the alcohol, if too cold it will be hard to mix

Mix the sugar mixture and the alchool
Leave it again for 30 days and mix on average onc a day
Adjust with more cachaça or sugar for personal taste

title: decoration
text:
chocolat noir: 200g
glucose: 120g
powdered sugar: 15g
water 15g





melt the chocolate
heat up the glucose
heat sugar and water until it is completly dissolved
add glucose and sugar sirup to the chocolate
mix until combined (ONLY MIX AFTER)
put in a pan with film, to cool down - ambiant temp is good to mold it

for a rose make circles and assemble them - you can put balls inside two layers of parchment paper, flatten them, put in freezer so its easier to get off the paper and mold them once they are in room temp again

title: mango cake dome
text:
Flour: 110g Baking Powder: 1 tsp Salt: Pinch (0.25 tsp) Sugar: 85g Butter: 50g Egg: 1 large Milk: 100ml Vanilla Extract: 1 tsp



Mango Puree: 200ml Egg Yolks: 3 large Sugar: 55g Cornstarch: 15g (about 1.5 tbsp) Milk: 100ml Salt: Pinch



Egg Whites: 3 large powdered Sugar: 75g

title: mango cake dome
text: Flour: 110g Baking Powder: 1 tsp Salt: Pinch (0.25 tsp) Sugar: 85g Butter: 50g Egg: 1 large Milk: 100ml Vanilla Extract: 1 tsp

title: mango cake dome
text: Mango Puree: 200ml Egg Yolks: 3 large Sugar: 55g Cornstarch: 15g (about 1.5 tbsp) Milk: 100ml Salt: Pinch

title: mango cake dome
text: Egg Whites: 3 large powdered Sugar: 75g

title: mango cake dome
text:
Step 1: Prepare the Vanilla Cake
Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease and line an 8-inch round cake pan. In a bowl, mix the flour, baking powder, and salt. In another bowl, cream the butter and sugar until fluffy. Add the egg and vanilla extract and mix well. Gradually mix in the dry ingredients and milk, alternating between the two, starting and ending with the dry ingredients. Pour the batter into the pan and bake for 20–25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Let it cool.

title: mango cake dome
text:
Step 2: Make the Mango Custard
In a medium saucepan, whisk together egg yolks, sugar, and cornstarch until smooth. Gradually add the mango puree, milk, and salt while whisking. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens (5–7 minutes). Remove from heat and let it cool, covering it with plastic wrap to prevent a skin from forming.

title: mango cake dome
text:
Step 3: Prepare the Mango Meringue
Beat the egg whites until soft peaks form. Gradually add the granulated sugar, one tablespoon at a time, and beat until stiff, glossy peaks form.

title: mango cake dome
text:
Step 4: Assemble the Cake
Place the vanilla cake layer on a serving platter. Spread the mango custard evenly over the vanilla cake. Gently spoon the mango meringue mixture over the custard layer, smoothing it with a spatula. Burn the meringue with a torch Chill the assembled cake in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours, or until set.

title: Finnish blueberry pie
text:
100 g unsalted butter, at room temperature
100 g cane or granulated sugar
1 large egg
200 g flour*
1 tsp baking powder
Pinch of cinamon





250 g fresh blueberries
250 g greek yogurt *
1 egg
¼ tsp cinamon
1 tsp vanilla
4 Tbsp cane sugar

* (gluten free works good here but also other types should work)

title: Finnish blueberry pie
text:
100 g unsalted butter, at room temperature
100 g cane or granulated sugar
1 large egg
200 g flour*
1 tsp baking powder
Pinch of cinamon





250 g fresh blueberries
250 g greek yogurt *
1 egg
¼ tsp cinamon
1 tsp vanilla
4 Tbsp cane sugar

* (gluten free works good here but also other types should work)

title: Finnish blueberry pie
text:
Preparation

For the crust:

Cream together the butter and sugar until fluffy and light.
Add in the egg, and mix.
Stir in the flour, pinch of cinamon, and baking powder just until combined into a pliable ball.
Place the soft dough onto your greased pan and use your hands to spread it into an even layer across the bottom and up the sides of the pan.
Poke the bottom with a fork and bake the empty crust for 10 mins.
Remove from the oven and let cool slightly.



For the Filling:

In a bowl whisk together the sour cream, egg, sugar, vanilla, and cinamon.
Spread the blueberries evenly across the baked crust. Carefully pour the filling over and around the berries.
Return to the oven and bake for 20-30 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the filling around the edges is set. The center should not look like uncooked liquid, but neither too dry and firm.
Remove from the oven and cool at room temperature for about 30 mins.

title: Chicken tacos
text:
Quatities are random on this one

Chicken thighs
Onion
Garlic clove
olive oil
Tomatoes peeled
Red wine
Cream
Avocado
Lemon
Flour
Salt & pepper

title: Chicken tacos
text:
Quatities are random on this one

Chicken thighs
Onion
Garlic clove
olive oil
Tomatoes peeled
Red wine
Cream
Avocado
Lemon
Flour
Salt & pepper

title: Chicken tacos
text:
Preparation

Make a tomato sauce by frying the garlic and onion in olive oil, and then adding the tomatoes and red wine to let simmer
Take the skin out of the thighs and fry it on medium heat to render the fat
Save the fat for later
Fry the chicken seasoned with salt and pepper
Add the tomato sauce to the chicken and some cream
You may add corn or rice flower to make this thicker
Mash the avocado and add lemon, salt and pepper to make a simple guac
Mix the rendered chicken fat with flour and water until you have enough dough and it is not sticky
flatten the dough to make the tortillas and put them on a pan to chard both sides
Assemble the tacos by putting the chicken and avocado and fold them in half
You may also add spicy sauce to taste or coriander or even yogurt sauce

title: Beer chicken
text:

½ medium onion

title: Beer chicken
text:

title: Beer chicken
text:
Preparation

Cut onions and garlic
Fry them in a cacerolle with olive oil
Add the knorr and let the chicken fry a bit
Add the beer and let it cook for around 30min or until the chicken is tender
At the same time you can make rice or mashed potatoes

title: Fish soup
text:

parsley

parsley

title: Fish soup
text:
Preparation

In a cacerolle put the fish, 1 onion cut in half,garlic, laurel, parsley, salt, pepper, half of the olive oil and cover with water.
Bring it to a boil and let cook for a while
In a 2nd cacerolle put the potatoes, tomato, carrot, 2nd onion, the rest of the olive oil, salt and cover withh water to boil.
Take the fish out of the first cacerolle and shred it
Strain the water used to cook the fish and save it
Blend the content of the second cacerolle and mix in water from cooking the fish
Add the fish and add salt and peper to taste if needed
Add coriander to taste

Add some water if needed
